item.title: Kayla add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Anis Mojgani
item.description: "Will it make me something? Will I be something? Am I something? And the answer comes, already am, always was, and I still have time to be" -- Anis Mojgani

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Desmond Tutu (Foreword)
item.description: "If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse, and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality." -- Desmond Tutu (Foreword)

item.title: Kayla add a quote by John Green
item.description: "…because nerds like us are allowed to be unironically enthusiastic about stuff… Nerds are allowed to love stuff, like jump-up-and-down-in-the-chair-can’t-control-yourself love it. Hank, when people call people nerds, mostly what they’re saying is ‘you like stuff.’ Which is just not a good insult at all. Like, ‘you are too enthusiastic about the miracle of human consciousness’." -- John Green

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Emotions, in my experience, aren't covered by single words. I don't believe in "sadness," "joy," or "regret." Maybe the best proof that the language is patriarchal is that it oversimplifies feeling. I'd like to have at my disposal complicated hybrid emotions, Germanic train-car constructions like, say, "the happiness that attends disaster." Or: "the disappointment of sleeping with one's fantasy." I'd like to show how "intimations of mortality brought on by aging family members" connects with "the hatred of mirrors that begins in middle age." I'd like to have a word for "the sadness inspired by failing restaurants" as well as for "the excitement of getting a room with a minibar." I've never had the right words to describe my life, and now that I've entered my story, I need them more than ever. " -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Nadezhda Mandelstam
item.description: "I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity." -- Nadezhda Mandelstam

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Richard Siken
item.description: "We have not touched the stars, nor are we forgiven, which brings us back to the hero’s shoulders and the gentleness that comes, not from the absence of violence, but despite the abundance of it." -- Richard Siken

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There was only one guy in the whole Bible Jesus ever personally promised a place with him in Paradise. Not Peter, not Paul, not any of those guys. He was a convicted thief, being executed. So don't knock the guys on death row. Maybe they know something you don't." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You have my whole heart. You always did." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Kayla add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "I have never met a heavy heart that wasn’t a phone booth with a red cape inside Some people will never understand the kind of superpower it takes for some people to just walk outside Some days I know my smile looks like the gutter of a falling house But my hands are always holding tight to the ripchord of believing" -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Kayla add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Please try to remember that what they believe, as well as what they do and cause you to endure does not testify to your inferiority but to their inhumanity" -- James Baldwin

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I want to feel all there is to feel, he thought. Let me feel tired, now, let me feel tired. I mustn't forget, I'm alive, I know I'm alive, I mustn't forget it tonight or tomorrow or the day after that." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You’ll find out it’s little savors and little things that count more than big ones. A walk on a spring morning is better than an eighty-mile ride in a hopped-up car, you know why? Because it’s full of flavors, full of a lot of things growing. You’ve time to seek and find. I know, you’re after the broad effect now, I suppose that’s fit and proper. But you got to look at grapes as well as watermelons. You greatly admire skeletons and I like fingerprints; well, and good. Right now such things are bothersome to you, and I wonder if it isn’t because you never learned to use them. If you had your way you’d pass a law to abolish all the little jobs, the little things. But then you’d leave yourselves nothing to do between the big jobs and you’d have a devil of a time thinking up things? Cutting grass and pulling weeds can be a way of life." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "To be careful with people and with words was a rare and beautiful thing." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it." -- Maya Angelou
